#Text=BBC Reporter Alan Johnston is released in Gaza
#Text=Wednesday , July 4 , 2007
#Text=A short time ago , we received the news we 've waited 114 days for – that Alan is free and is safe – and we are overjoyed .
#Text=The last 114 days have been a dreadful time for us – but particularly for Alan .
#Text=Through it all , we never lost hope .
#Text=Alan had always told us of the friends he 'd made in Gaza .
#Text=We knew , in the end , they would be there for him .
#Text=We 've always known Alan was special .
#Text=But the last 14 weeks have shown us how special he is to others – to his friends in Gaza , to his colleagues at the BBC , and to the listeners and viewers who 've written in their thousands .
#Text=Their support has buoyed us up through the darkest days .
#Text=We 've drawn our strength from them .
#Text=—
#Text=Graham , Margaret and Katriona Johnston ( his father , mother and sister ) .
#Text=The BBC 's correspondent Alan Johnston based in Gaza has been freed after almost four months in captivity .
#Text=The BBC broadcast images of Alan Johnston leaving a building in Gaza and entering a white car .
#Text=Hamas police surrounded a building where it was believed Johnston was being held .
#Text=Earlier , Hamas had captured several members of the Army of Islam and continued to put pressure , by threat of force , on the captors .
#Text=An intervention by another militant group , the Popular Resistance Committees , led to a breakthrough in negotiations between Hamas and the Army of Islam .
#Text=Rallies were held worldwide and an online petition calling for Johnston 's release was signed by over 200,000 people .
#Text=On Johnston 's appearance after his release a witness said that he appeared healthy , but had lost weight .
#Text=" We have been able to close this chapter which has harmed the image of our people greatly , " said Khaled Meshaal , leader of Hamas .
#Text=" The efforts by Hamas have produced the freedom of Alan Johnston . "

#Text=On the subject of Fatah , Meshaal told Reuters , " It showed the difference between the era in which a group used to encourage and commit security anarchy and chaos and the current situation in which Hamas is seeking to stabilise security . "
#Text=Hamas had stated that they were anxious to have Johnston freed to highlight differences in their ability to provide security in Gaza as compared to Fatah .
#Text=Alan Johnston was the only western correspondent working full-time in Gaza .
#Text=He went missing on March 12th 2007 .
#Text=Concern for his safety grew last month as a video released by the Army of Islam showed Johnston wearing a vest packed with explosives .

#Text=In a press conference with Hamas Prime Minister Ismail Haniya , Alan Johnston said he felt ' buried alive and detached from the world ' and that he gained hope through listening to the radio and the support that he has received from around the world .
#Text=He also thanked the Hamas leader and security services .
#Text=His parents held a press conference just after 7 a.m. ( BST ) on the 4th of July .
#Text=The parents said that they never gave up hope over the 114 days .
#Text=They received a phone call late last night where he told them briefly that he was okay .
#Text=The parents ended wanting to thank people for helping them get through this difficult time and for keeping their spirits up .
#Text=Gordon Brown
#Text=Prime Minister of Britain issued a statement on the release of Alan Johnston at his first Prime Minister 's Questions .
#Text=" I welcome the good news of Alan Johnston 's release .

#Text=This will come as a great relief to his family and friends , and all those who have worked to see him freed .
